content:
The sentence "she \_\_\_\_ always\_\_\_\_ to bring her books" requires two verbs to be grammatically correct. To make a complete sentence, you could fill in the blanks with the verbs "forgets" and "forgets".

* She "forgets" always "to bring" her books.

Alternatively, you could use different verbs, as long as they make sense in the sentence:

* She "neglects" always "to carry" her books.
* She "has trouble" always "remembering" her books.

It depends on the context and what you want to convey with the sentence.
